<a id="Node2D"></a>

# Node2D

**Inherits:** [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

**Inherited By:** [AnimatedSprite2D](AnimatedSprite2D.md), [AudioListener2D](AudioListener2D.md), [AudioStreamPlayer2D](AudioStreamPlayer2D.md), [BackBufferCopy](BackBufferCopy.md), [Bone2D](Bone2D.md), [Camera2D](Camera2D.md), [CanvasGroup](CanvasGroup.md), [CanvasModulate](CanvasModulate.md), [CollisionObject2D](CollisionObject2D.md), [CollisionPolygon2D](CollisionPolygon2D.md), [CollisionShape2D](CollisionShape2D.md), [CPUParticles2D](CPUParticles2D.md), [GPUParticles2D](GPUParticles2D.md), [Joint2D](Joint2D.md), [Light2D](Light2D.md), [LightOccluder2D](LightOccluder2D.md), [Line2D](Line2D.md), [Marker2D](Marker2D.md), [MeshInstance2D](MeshInstance2D.md), [MultiMeshInstance2D](MultiMeshInstance2D.md), [NavigationLink2D](NavigationLink2D.md), [NavigationObstacle2D](NavigationObstacle2D.md), [NavigationRegion2D](NavigationRegion2D.md), [Parallax2D](Parallax2D.md), [ParallaxLayer](ParallaxLayer.md), [Path2D](Path2D.md), [PathFollow2D](PathFollow2D.md), [Polygon2D](Polygon2D.md), [RayCast2D](RayCast2D.md), [RemoteTransform2D](RemoteTransform2D.md), [ShapeCast2D](ShapeCast2D.md), [Skeleton2D](Skeleton2D.md), [Sprite2D](Sprite2D.md), [TileMap](TileMap.md), [TileMapLayer](TileMapLayer.md), [TouchScreenButton](TouchScreenButton.md), [VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D](VisibleOnScreenNotifier2D.md)

A 2D game object, inherited by all 2D-related nodes. Has a position, rotation, scale, and skew.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A 2D game object, with a transform (position, rotation, and scale). All 2D nodes, including physics objects and sprites, inherit from Node2D. Use Node2D as a parent node to move, scale and rotate children in a 2D project. Also gives control of the node's render order.

\ **Note:** Since both **Node2D** and [Control](Control.md) inherit from [CanvasItem](CanvasItem.md), they share several concepts from the class such as the [CanvasItem.z_index](CanvasItem.md#CanvasItem_property_z_index) and [CanvasItem.visible](CanvasItem.md#CanvasItem_property_visible) properties.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Custom drawing in 2D](../tutorials/2d/custom_drawing_in_2d.md)

- [All 2D Demos](https://github.com/redot-engine/redot-demo-projects/tree/master/2d)

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **position** = `Vector2(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_position)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_position**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_position**\ (\ )

Position, relative to the node's parent. See also [global_position](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_position).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_property_rotation"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **rotation** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_rotation)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rotation**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_rotation**\ (\ )

Rotation in radians, relative to the node's parent. See also [global_rotation](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_rotation).

\ **Note:** This property is edited in the inspector in degrees. If you want to use degrees in a script, use [rotation_degrees](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_rotation_degrees).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_property_rotation_degrees"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **rotation_degrees** [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_rotation_degrees)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_rotation_degrees**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_rotation_degrees**\ (\ )

Helper property to access [rotation](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_rotation) in degrees instead of radians. See also [global_rotation_degrees](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_rotation_degrees).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_property_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **scale** = `Vector2(1, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_scale)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_scale**\ (\ value\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ )
- [Vector2](Vector2.md) **get_scale**\ (\ )

The node's scale, relative to the node's parent. Unscaled value: ``(1, 1)``. See also [global_scale](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_scale).

\ **Note:** Negative X scales in 2D are not decomposable from the transformation matrix. Due to the way scale is represented with transformation matrices in Redot, negative scales on the X axis will be changed to negative scales on the Y axis and a rotation of 180 degrees when decomposed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_property_skew"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **skew** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_skew)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_skew**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_skew**\ (\ )

If set to a non-zero value, slants the node in one direction or another. This can be used for pseudo-3D effects. See also [global_skew](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_skew).

\ **Note:** Skew is performed on the X axis only, and *between* rotation and scaling.

\ **Note:** This property is edited in the inspector in degrees. If you want to use degrees in a script, use ``skew = deg_to_rad(value_in_degrees)``.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_property_transform"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **transform** [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_property_transform)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_transform**\ (\ value\: [Transform2D](Transform2D.md)\ )
- [Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **get_transform**\ (\ )

The node's [Transform2D](Transform2D.md), relative to the node's parent. See also [global_transform](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_global_transform).

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="Node2D_method_apply_scale"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **apply_scale**\ (\ ratio\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_apply_scale)

Multiplies the current scale by the `ratio` vector.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_get_angle_to"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[float](float.md) **get_angle_to**\ (\ point\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_get_angle_to)

Returns the angle between the node and the `point` in radians.

\ [Illustration of the returned angle.](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/redot-engine/redot-docs/master/img/node2d_get_angle_to.png)

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_get_relative_transform_to_parent"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Transform2D](Transform2D.md) **get_relative_transform_to_parent**\ (\ parent\: [Node](Node.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_get_relative_transform_to_parent)

Returns the [Transform2D](Transform2D.md) relative to this node's parent.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_global_translate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **global_translate**\ (\ offset\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_global_translate)

Adds the `offset` vector to the node's global position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_look_at"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **look_at**\ (\ point\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_look_at)

Rotates the node so that its local +X axis points towards the `point`, which is expected to use global coordinates.

\ `point` should not be the same as the node's position, otherwise the node always looks to the right.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_move_local_x"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **move_local_x**\ (\ delta\: [float](float.md), scaled\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_move_local_x)

Applies a local translation on the node's X axis with the amount specified in `delta`. If `scaled` is ``false``, normalizes the movement to occur independently of the node's [scale](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_scale).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_move_local_y"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **move_local_y**\ (\ delta\: [float](float.md), scaled\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_move_local_y)

Applies a local translation on the node's Y axis with the amount specified in `delta`. If `scaled` is ``false``, normalizes the movement to occur independently of the node's [scale](Node2D.md#Node2D_property_scale).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_rotate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **rotate**\ (\ radians\: [float](float.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_rotate)

Applies a rotation to the node, in radians, starting from its current rotation.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_to_global"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **to_global**\ (\ local_point\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_to_global)

Transforms the provided local position into a position in global coordinate space. The input is expected to be local relative to the **Node2D** it is called on. e.g. Applying this method to the positions of child nodes will correctly transform their positions into the global coordinate space, but applying it to a node's own position will give an incorrect result, as it will incorporate the node's own transformation into its global position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_to_local"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](Vector2.md) **to_local**\ (\ global_point\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_to_local)

Transforms the provided global position into a position in local coordinate space. The output will be local relative to the **Node2D** it is called on. e.g. It is appropriate for determining the positions of child nodes, but it is not appropriate for determining its own position relative to its parent.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="Node2D_method_translate"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **translate**\ (\ offset\: [Vector2](Vector2.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#Node2D_method_translate)

Translates the node by the given `offset` in local coordinates.
